intro.para: Here we present a number of operations which produce new continuous functions from continuous given ones. Specifically:

li.para: The sum of two continuous function f,g\from D\to \RNr is continuous.
The product of two continuous function f,g\from D\to \RNr is continuous.
The composite of two continuous functions is continuous.

intro.para: Combining these results with the fact that the identity function on \RNr is continuous, we see that

li.para: rational functions are continuous away from the 0’s of the denominator.

intro.para: We close this section with the ‘pasting lemma’. It says that two continuous functions
may be ‘pasted’ together so as to obtain a continuous \OOIntrvl{a}{c}\to \RNr whenever f(b)=g(b).
